text: Is there a way to force a maximum width image with an image field in a custom module? Some users are uploading gigantic images and I would like to only show images at the specified width of a template. One idea would be to have a setting in the field that lets devs specify a max size and the author would see an error message if they exceed that limit.
The goal for this is to help make pages lean to improve page load speed.

There’s a few things you can do. Use <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/functions#resize-image-url|resize_image_url> as a fallback in-case they provide an oversized image. When using an actual img element, put a width  and height attributes on the img. (will resize like the function will, but will also generate a srcset)
In general though those should be treated as a fallback. Always encourage best practices for uploading properly sized images on the web.
You could use help text to encourage keeping within a set of dimensions
Hi Jon. Ok thank you. Yeah I have the image size in the help text and also part of the label in parenthesis. : )

`resize_image_url` doesn't work with large images though (over 4096px) and regardless of how much I educate clients, add in help messages with "please, please, please upload reasonable image sizes" many ignore that and upload crazy 8000px -10000px+ images :disappointed:

It would be great to be able to set a maximum image size on the field.

ok yeah that could be an issue I am running into. Our marketing team has access to images that are also used in print and so huge and images are uploaded willy nilly not understanding how big they are
since HubSpot is a digital space, why would they allow images that large anyways?

We do not assume to know what you’re using the images for. Allowing you customers to upload images of any size ensures they can do whatever they need.

Example use-case from my past as an agency developer: We had a vehicle manufacturer. They allowed downloading full res images of their vehicles to use as wallpapers/print/etc. On the actual page you’d only see the resized version, you’d only get the full version when you clicked a download button.

That use-case wouldn’t work well if we restricted file sizes arbitrarily.
I do see what you’re saying about being able to impose a limit on the field though

Maybe it just needs a good alert message with a link to an article explaining the important of small image sizes on page load speed. Then make them confirm they know what they are doing to cover your use case above.

Please vote if you think it is worth improving. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Add-ability-to-set-a-maximum-image-size-on-the-image-field-to/idi-p/349193#M59587>

True, it does make sense to have the full size image available in that type of scenario, but having the option to limit the size on the field would be helpful (e.g. a cards slider module where the image will never be more than 300px wide with twelve 8000px images is pretty painful)
